msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Puget Sound Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: King County Government, Judicial Administration. Territorial District Court Case Files, 1867-1889

div1.p: In the Dist Court of the 3d Jud Dist of Washington Territory held at Seattle in and for the counties of King Kistap and Snohomish
In the matter of the application of Peter Nelson W Smith H Elsner C Whaley G Matson Charles Lundblad Dennis Coffy & Jacob Annir for a writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Hon JR Lewis Judge &c and now come the aforesaid applicants on 5th May of to the sufficing and the return of the said Lewis V Wycoff Dpty Marshal &c to the said Sg.
1st that said return does not show upon what charge or for what offense said applicants are held, or before what court they are held to answer

2 And said applicants aver the truth and fact to be as follows viz: that on or about the 8th day of April AD 1875 they shiped on board the Bark Gem
of the Ocean L E Gray Master for a voyage from San Francisco to Seattle Puget Sound, And that afterwards on or about the 11th day of the same month the said master proceeded to sail with said Bark and with these applicants on board without them signing any shipping contracts or agreement in writing or in print whatever that on or about the 23d day of April aforesaid, the said Bark arrived at the Port of Seattle King County Washington Territory at which time & place said applicants are entitled to then discharge from said vessel, and then and there demanded to be so dischaged and paid off and that in consequence of such demand to be discharged and paid off, and for no other cause, the said Master L.E. Gray procured the arrest and imprisonment of these applicants after the arrest of said
vessel at said port of Seattle as aforesaid for alleged disobedience of orders and lawful commands of said Master and Officers of said Bark.
Also said return is in the and insufficient
